snippet: The visit between President Obama and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is to occur before a Group of 20 conference this fall, but it was being arranged at an awkward time.
abstract: Pres Obama accepts an invitation to meet with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin ahead of Group of 20 conference, signaling new opportunity to ease tensions even as Kremlin continues to bristle over American effort to punish Russian citizens accused of violating human rights.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The visit between President Obama and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is to occur before a Group of 20 conference this fall, but it was being arranged at an awkward time.

headline.seo: Tensions High, Obama Agrees to Meet With Putin
headline.main: As U.S. Seeks Security Pact, Obama Is Set to Meet Putin
headline.print_headline: As U.S. Seeks Security Pact, Obama Is Set to Meet Putin
